intro: Witheringia hunzikeri, commonly known as the Cape York daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and has a low, spreading habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. It is adapted to sandy soils and can tolerate salt spray, making it a hardy species in its native habitat. Witheringia hunzikeri is often found in heathlands and coastal dunes, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
